field_wysiwyg.value:
We encourage you to visit when most convenient for you and the patient. There are no set visitor hours for most departments. Exceptions are listed below:

Medical, surgical, and hospice wards

24 hours a day, 7 days a week

Behavioral health inpatient wards

1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m. -7:30 p.m., 7 days a week

Critical care

Visiting hours will be individualized to meet the needs of the patient, family and caregivers.

Post-anesthesia recovery

Generally, visitors are not permitted. In certain circumstances, the doctor or nurse may make an exception.

General visitor policies

  • Children under the age of 16 must be directly supervised by an adult, and bedside visits are limited to 15 minutes. 
  • Children under the ages of 16 are not permitted in the dialysis unit due to infection control and safety reasons. 
  • Children under the age of 16 are not permitted to visit the psychiatric units without the physician's permission.
  • While in restraints, patients may not have visitors. 
  • Seriously ill and hospice patients may have visits unless the staff physician determines that the patient's condition is such that visits should be restricted to specific times.
  • Staff may ask visitors to leave the room when performing patient care. 
  • Visitors are not permitted to bring weapons, cameras or other prohibited articles into the medical center except when conducting official business authorized by the Director or designee.
  • Visitors with communicable diseases are not permitted in the medical center.
  • Visitors must observe the infection control signs and should report to the nurses' station for instructions before entering a patient room.
  • Visitors must observe hand hygiene policy guidelines requiring hand hygiene on entry and exit from patient rooms and at other times as directed by staff.
  • Visitors may bring candy, fruit and other food items in limited quantities if it has been clarified by the nursing staff as appropriate for the patient's diet. 
  • Fresh fruit and flowers are not permitted in the Critical Care Center.
  • Visitors are not permitted to eat or drink in the units.
  • Members of the religious community are encouraged to visit patients who are members of their local churches and/or synagogues. However, under no circumstances are they permitted to do general visitation by going from bed to bed, ward to ward or unit to unit.
